titleStmt.title: A vvarning-peece to the Commons, Commissioners, Army ge, nerall [sic], which now sit as judges on His Majesties sacred person, in the behalfe of the whole kingdome. Written by one that feares God, and honors his King, and prayeth for the peace of England
titleStmt.author: One that feares God, and honors his King.

titleStmt.title: A vvarning-peece to the Commons, Commissioners, Army ge, nerall [sic], which now sit as judges on His Majesties sacred person, in the behalfe of the whole kingdome. Written by one that feares God, and honors his King, and prayeth for the peace of England
titleStmt.author: One that feares God, and honors his King.

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p.1 reads: A vindication of the army, by way of recrimination against the Lords & Commons, &c.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

person.persName: One that feares God, and honors his King.
